ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Increasing ARC writer pool size mid-crawl

Tom Emerson wrote:

> stack writes:
> > Regards contention, here is an old survey we did:
> > 
> http://crawler.archive.org/cgi-bin/wiki.pl?ThreadsFrontierWriterComparisons 
>
> > (With BDBFrontier, fewer ARCs seemed better -- but about time we redid
> > the survey).
>
> This is interesting reading, thanks. Could I ask you to elaborate why
> increasing the number of writers seemed to lower through-put?

Embarrassingly, we didn't spend enough time looking.  More writers would 
mean more contention for the disk head possibly holding threads in the 
write step for longer but iostat at the time didn't seem to show this as 
being the issue -- the disk was lightly loaded (Generally we don't put 
up much of a disk i/o loading, not unless you disable gzipping).

St.Ack
